greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = greatest k for which A155043(n+k) < A155043(n); a(n) = A263077(n)-n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..124340
example: For n=1 we have A049820(1) = 0, thus A155043(1) = 1, and 0 is the only (and thus the largest) number from which zero can be reached with less steps (namely in zero steps, A155043(0) = 0), thus a(1) = 0 - 1 = -1.
mathematica: a[0] = 0; a[n_] := a[n] = 1 + a[n - DivisorSigma[0, n]]; Table[k = 3 n;
While[a@ k >= a@ n, k--]; k - n, {n, 102}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Oct 13 2015 *)
xref: Cf. A263079 (indices of the negative terms), A263080 (of the positive terms).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 09 2015
